comments:
I just opened Eclipse I saw that my entire workbench layout was reset.

Digging into the stack trace, I saw a lot of stack traces with "no more handles", dozens of them probably written during the last workbench shutdown (they have almost the same timestamp). But the first one has a Mylyn in package name and I'm posting here:

If I'm not wrong, at that time I was taking a pass through unread bugs on my task list, and opened/closed at lot of task editors. I'm wondering if can mylyn be leaking resources?

We have done pretty extensive profiling and are no longer aware of any leaks.  Opening a task editor uses a number of handles, but should not leak them.  The last fix did not make it in until the last dev build (bug 196205) so there is a chance that this is a duplicate and I'll mark it as such (but it is unlikely to hit that bug during normal operation).  Other than that, please note bug 84620 and my comments on bug 193761 (that launching VMs with PDE causes problems) and report any further experiences either here or there.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 196205 ***
Just FYI, this happened during a normal operation (no runtime workspace, eclipse launched from windows) with build 20070717-1130.
Were you using any embedded web browsers?  Those are the most likely cause of handles leaks (fixed for Eclipse 3.4M1 and 3.3.1).
Nope. My eclipse is configured to use external browser (firefox).
Good to know.  Are you launching runtime workspaces.  Are you using Sun's Java 6 VM?
